I could not understand why but I still bought the ticket because I was crazy about Danny Brook. Then, I went into the theatre on time but became a little bit angry forafter waiting until 20:15, forty-five minutes after the expected starting time. Furthermore, I was so disappointed to find out that Danny Brook was not on the stage and the leading actor sang so badbadly that I left the theatre before it finished. At lastLast, I went to the theatre restaurant but it was closed because it needed cleaning.

column6: A week later, when I was still in a bad mood, my form teacher, Mrs Brown, talked about jobs in our English lesson. She told us there were numerous types of job in the world. Some offered a high salary while some did not. However, they are equalequally important for our society. 'Who wants to be a doctor?' She asked. Many students raised their hands. 'Who wants to be a lawyer?' Again, many students put up their hand. But when she asked who wanted to be a cleaner, nobody raised his hand and I felt so shamefulashamed that I lowered my head. 'Cleaner is a very good job.' Mrs Brown said within a loud voice. 'If there were no cleanercleaners, who would clean the school for us, who? Who would keep the environment nice and tidy.?' Suddenly, all themy classmates applauded and smiled toat me with respect. The teacher also grinned and I was so impressed and repeated the words in my heart: 'All the jobs have the same importance.'
